This is new record to Zhejiang. The species is one of the most widely distributed species in China while its relatives are restricted to rather smaller areas. The main differences between these species affect the male characters (see Tang and Li 2010a ). The Taiwanese records of the species are based on Scaphidium grande var. inimpressum Pic which was synonymized by Loebl in 1992. Several specimens in our collection from Taiwan are considered to be a closely related species of Scaphidium grande , and this might imply that Scaphidium grande inimpressum Pic is a good species. To clarify the doubt, a study on the type material of Scaphidium grande inimpressum Pic and more related material from Taiwan will be necessary; the distribution of Scaphidium grande in Taiwan is now doubtful.
